Issues.Title: fix(core): include inner ViewContainerRef anchor nodes into ViewRef.rootNodes output
Issues.Body:
Currently, the `ViewRef.rootNodes` output is missing anchor (comment) nodes for inner `ViewContainerRef`s, when an anchor node was created for that instance of a `ViewContainerRef` (which happens in all cases except when an <ng-container> was used as a host for a view container).

This issue affects hydration logic, which relies on the number of root nodes within a view to properly determine segments in DOM that belong to a particular view.

Resolves #49849.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

Issues.Title: ngModelChange fires twice on mat-chip-listbox
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

ngModelChange on the material chip listbox is not only triggered when selecting a value, but also a second time when clicking anywhere in the browser window with the mouse.
The occurs only once and with the first mouse-click after a previous value has been selected. The thereby emitted value is the same as the previous one.
It does not occur when clicking on another chip with the next mouse-click.

Steps to reproduce:

1. click on a chip to select a value
2. click somewhere in the window (just not on a chip) to trigger the event a second time

### Is this a regression?

Issues.Title: Strongly Typed Reactive Forms with Domain Interface
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

forms

### Description

I would like to be able to pass my Domain interface to a formgroup, so that refactorings of property names are also applied to the forms or at least give compile time warnings.

Take this example interface model which is send to a rest endpoint by the Http-Client:
```
  export interface LoginModel {
  username: string;
  password: string;
}
```

For this model I have to create a FormModel:
```
export interface LoginFormModel extends FormGroup<{
  username: FormControl<string>,
  password: FormControl<string>
}> {}
```

Now I always have to keep the two interfaces in sync, when I change username to UserName and it is wasted time effort. 


### Proposed solution

I think it should be possible to infer types from a interface.

- primitives to FormControl
- Arrays and Sets to FormArray
- Object references to FormGroup

Something similar like https://github.com/iamguid/ngx-mf,
but officially supported and maintained without @ts-ignore workarounds.
 

### Alternatives considered

Keep the current state and create additional interfaces or just let the form infer types.
This does not address the refactoring issues, when property names change.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Strongly Typed Reactive Forms with Domain Interface" (#49859)

Issues.Title: Unable to use removeControl method for a typed FormGroup
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

forms

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

I have the following form group declare in my typescript file:

`myFormGroup: FormGroup<MyFormInterface>;`

`export interface MyFormInterface {
  id: FormControl<number>;
  type: FormControl<MyType | null>;
  amount: FormControl<number>;
  comment: FormControl<string | null>;
  optional1?: FormControl<string | null>;
  optional2?: FormControl<string | null>;
}`

When I change my type value I want to remove optional1 or optional2 according to the value by running the following code:
`this.myFormGroup.removeControl('optional1');`

But I'm facing an compilation error. To fix it I had to write it that way:
`(this.myFormGroup as FormGroup).removeControl('optional1');`



### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
Error: src/app/page-expense-edition/expense-edition-form/expense-edition-form.component.ts:67:9 - error TS2769: No overload matches this call.
  Overload 1 of 2, '(this: FormGroup<{ [key: string]: AbstractControl<any, any>; }>, name: string, options?: { emitEvent?: boolean | undefined; } | undefined): void', gave the following error.
    The 'this' context of type 'FormGroup<ExpenseEditionForm>' is not assignable to method's 'this' of type 'FormGroup<{ [key: string]: AbstractControl<any, any>; }>'.
  Overload 2 of 2, '(name: never, options?: { emitEvent?: boolean | undefined; } | undefined): void', gave the following error.
    Argument of type 'string' is not assignable to parameter of type 'never'.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: Binding syntax in text literal is not an error or warning
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

I have this beautiful highlighting issue in a component's html file, in which if I write an input between the element tags and not inside the angle brackets, it highlights as if it were a real input. This gave me a big headache trying to figure out why I wasn't getting any data in the receiving component. 
 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73020686/232042871-943364ac-3980-48b2-8d26-5f3cd94f65af.png)

I'm not sure which package this has to do with, but here are my dev dependencies

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: update angular" (#25020)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): fully remove third-party sourcemaps when disabled in esbuild builder
Issues.Body: When using the esbuild-based browser application builder, third-party sourcemaps will now be fully removed when the `sourcemap` option's `vendor` sub-option is disabled. The `vendor` sub-option is disabled by default and is only enabled if explicitly enabled within the project's configuration. Sourcemaps are considered third-party if their referencing code is contained within a `node_modules` directory. Previously, sourcemap URL comments may have been unintentionally left intact when processing third-party code via the Babel-based JavaScript transformer. These sourcemap URL comments are now removed correctly when code is both transformed and return directly when no transformation is required.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): fully remove third-party sourcemaps when disabled in esbuild builder" (#25015)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular/cli): update E2E command alias
Issues.Body: The mistake was introduced in a previous commit that introduced registration of lazy loading of commands.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular/cli): update E2E command alias" (#25016)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): correctly show initial files in stat table with esbuild builder
Issues.Body: When using the esbuild-based browser application builder, only actual initial files will be displayed in the initial files section. Previously, certain dynamically imported files could unintentionally be displayed in the stats output table as initial files. This was a display only error and had no effect on the files added to the index HTML file.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): correctly show initial files in stat table with esbuild builder" (#25017)

Issues.Title: ci: update CI `.bazelrc` to better support CI systems.
Issues.Body:
A number of small changes with comments here. The main one is that removing `--noshow_progress` will make Bazel print progress updates which tells Circle CI that test execution is still ongoing and avoids test failures due to lack of output.

The other notable trade-offs being made here are:
1. [`--keep_going`](https://bazel.build/docs/user-manual#keep-going) means `bazel test` will run all tests report all failures, which could be slower and noisier than reporting just the first failure but is more complete.
2. [`--build_tests_only`](https://bazel.build/docs/user-manual#build-tests-only) means only tests and binaries will be built, so any library targets not tested could have build errors hidden. Any such important targets should either be tested or use Skylib's `build_test()`.

The UI options mostly came from [this talk](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j332WfhNAFg).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci: update CI `.bazelrc` to better support CI systems." (#25019)

Issues.Title: test(@angular-devkit/build-angular): execute all basic E2E tests with esbuild builder
Issues.Body: With the increased feature parity of the esbuild-based browser application builder, all the basic E2E tests can now be executed against the builder. Several of the output checks were required to be updated to reflect the differences in console output, lazy chunk file naming, and less required initial files in the index HTML.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "test(@angular-devkit/build-angular): execute all basic E2E tests with esbuild builder" (#25024)

Issues.Title: Feature: add default export option when using a schematic to generate a component
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Feature: add default export option when using a schematic to generate a component" (#25023)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): update list of known tailwind configuration files
Issues.Body:
With this change we added `tailwind.config.mjs` and `tailwind.config.ts` to known tailwind config files.

Closes #24943
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): update list of known tailwind configuration files" (#25022)

Issues.Title: Sass errors after migrating from Angular 13 to 15 / Node 14 to 18
Issues.Body:
### Command

build, test

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

13

### Description

We are seeing flaky Sass errors during `ng build` and `ng test` after upgrading our project from Angular 13 to 15. We use a custom theme on the legacy components.

I have disabled optimization in order to see the stack trace of the error, however the output is different each time it fails as is the error.

Errors:
Unterminated string token
SassError: Can't find stylesheet to import.
SassError: Undefined variable.
SassError: Module loop: this module is already being loaded.

angular.json
```
  "styles": [
    "src/styles/theme.scss",
    "src/styles/styles.scss"
  ],
  "stylePreprocessorOptions": {
    "includePaths": ["src/styles"]
  },
```

_variables.scss
```
@use '@angular/material' as mat;
$fun2-light-color: #323a45;
...
```

theme.scss
```
@use '@angular/material' as mat;
@use 'variables' as v;

$app-theme: mat.define-light-theme(
  (
    color: (
      primary: v.$primary,
      accent: v.$accent,
    ),
  )
);
@include mat.all-legacy-component-typographies();
@include mat.legacy-core();
@include mat.all-legacy-component-themes($app-theme);
```

styles.scss
```
@use '@angular/material' as mat;
@use 'variables' as v;

body {
  margin: 0;
}
...
```

```
fun.component.scss
@use 'variables' as v;

  .accept {
    border: 2px solid v.$fun2-disabled-color;
  }
...
```



### Minimal Reproduction

These errors only happen in our Jenkins pipeline, where a Chromium image with Node 18.15 is installed. 

1. npm ci --legacy-peer-deps
2. npm run ngcc
3. ng test --code-coverage --watch=false --browsers ChromiumHeadlessDebug --reporters=progress,coverage
4. ng build --configuration production

Issues.Title: Revert "ci: bump Angular dependencies to `16.0.0-rc.0`"
Issues.Body:
This reverts commit 290e06018d3934cf27a5734a60947dcd7b45fa58.

Release checks don't like being in an RC state and it's not strictly necessary since installing a `-next` package will install `-rc` because it alphabetically follows. This means generating applications with `-next` in the `package.json` will still pull the latest RC releases of Angular packages.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Revert "ci: bump Angular dependencies to `16.0.0-rc.0`"" (#25014)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular/cli): register CLI commands lazily
Issues.Body:
Currently there is a lot of overhead coming from requiring external modules when registering commands such as `ng update` and `ng add`. This is because these commands do not lazily require all the modules causes the resolution of unneeded packages to be part of the critical path.

With this change we "requireâ€ only the command that we we need to execute, which reduce the number of node modules resolutions in the critical path.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular/cli): register CLI commands lazily" (#25013)

Issues.Title: `ng serve` with esbuild source maps causing chrome, vscode to be extremely slow
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

n/a, it's new with 16-rc0

### Description

I have this configured in my angular.json 

```
"sourceMap": {
								"scripts": true,
								"styles": true,
								"vendor": false,
								"hidden": false
							},
```

Yet it seems that all source maps, even from all my node_modules files are being loaded. this makes firing up a launch from vscode super slow as it tries to parse all the source maps. Chrome and VSCode locks up and CPU spikes for almost 10 seconds, and I'm on an M1 chip. Seems like there's just too much traffic than normal going between them.

Seems like `vendorChunks` option isn't supported, which may be a contributing factor to the problem.

When I hit a breakpoint in my code, just hitting 'step over' is very slow for it to happen. 

### Minimal Reproduction

ng serve with sourcemaps, im guessing problem may be worse with more vendor files but not sure

### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 16.0.0-rc.0
Node: 16.14.2
Package Manager: npm 9.6.3
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 16.0.0-rc.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.1600.0-rc.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular      16.0.0-rc.0
@angular-devkit/core               16.0.0-rc.0
@angular-devkit/schematics         16.0.0-rc.0
@angular/cdk                       16.0.0-next.5
@angular/flex-layout               15.0.0-beta.42
@angular/material                  16.0.0-next.5
@angular/material-moment-adapter   16.0.0-next.5
@schematics/angular                16.0.0-rc.0
rxjs                               7.8.0
```
```


### Anything else relevant?

my own notes... `sourceMapPathOverrides` was changed from 
`"webpack:///./src/*": "${workspaceFolder}/client/src/*"`
to `"http://localhost:4200/*": "${workspaceFolder}/client/*"`
`webroot` was changed from `"webRoot": "${workspaceFolder}",` to `"webRoot": "${workspaceFolder}/client",`

Issues.Title: esbuild ng serve not watching files outside project root
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

v16.0.0-next.7

### Description

Using nx workspace style project where app is in `apps/some-app` and it imports code from projects inside `projects/some-project`. When i use `ng serve some-app` with esbuild, changes in `projects/some-project` does not trigger reload.

The code in `project/some-project` is reference using `tsconfig.json` `paths`.

```json
{
  "compilerOptions": {
       "paths": {
              "@org/some-project": ["projects/some-project/src/index.ts"]
       }
}
```

This used to work in v16.0.0-next.7 and with webpack based ng serve

### Minimal Reproduction

- create a new nx workspace
- create an application
- create a library
- use the library in the application
- run `ng serve` with esbuild for the application
- make changes the the referenced library
- reload is not triggered

### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
v16.0.0-rc-0
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

Issues.Title: Angular CLI Analytics ID causes Docker build to hang
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

Angular 14

### Description

I'm trying to build an Angular 15 project in Docker, but with CLI analytics enabled, the build always hangs at the RUN npm run build step and never completes.

### Minimal Reproduction

See minimal reproduction here:
https://github.com/KevinDufendach/ng-15-docker-build-issue

This a fresh Angular 15.2.5 "ng new" project with the Dockerfile, .dockerignore, and nginx.conf copied from a working Angular 14 fresh install. Run "ng serve" and allowed usage analytics. Then, to reproduce, run the command:

```
docker build .
```

`Dockerfile`
```
FROM node:16-alpine as builder

COPY package.json package-lock.json ./
RUN npm set strict-ssl false
RUN npm ci && mkdir /app && mv ./node_modules ./app
WORKDIR /app
COPY . /app/

RUN npm run build # Builds successfully but never moves to next step
```

This can be fixed by setting the "cli" analytics to "false":

`angular.json`
```
"cli": {
  "analytics": false,
},
```

Fix mentioned here: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/75981611/how-do-i-fix-docker-getting-stuck-at-run-npm-run-build-with-angular-15/75999756#75999756

### Exception or Error

_No response_

```text
Angular CLI: 15.2.5
Node: 18.15.0
Package Manager: npm 9.2.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 15.2.6
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

---------------------------------------------------------

@angular-devkit/core            15.2.5
@angular-devkit/schematics      15.2.5
@angular/cli                    15.2.5

Issues.Title: fix(material/core): remove tabindex from mat-option
Issues.Body:
Remove the tabindex attribute added to MatOption components. MatOption does not need tabindex because the parent component manages focus by setting `aria-activedescendant` attribute. Previously, MatOption set tabindex but was also a referenced by aria-activedescendant. This was not the correct ARIA semantics. Align closer to ARIA spec by using only aria-activedescendant rather than both.

Tabindex="-1" seems to be causing a problem in angular#26861 where VoiceOver with Firefox moves DOM focus from the combobox to the option when opening the listbox popup.

Unblocks angular#26861.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/core): remove tabindex from mat-option" (#26917)

Issues.Title: MatAutoComplete and CDKVirtualScrollViewPort issues with selected indicator
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

I don't know if this is a regression with Angular 15 MDC, as we only tried using this recently, and not on a previous angular version.

### Description

When trying to use a cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport with a mat-autocomplete the selected checkmark indicator is repeatedly displayed for unselected options, and regular intervals, based on where the actual selected item is in the list.

### Reproduction

```
    <mat-autocomplete #auto="matAutocomplete" [displayWith]="supplierDisplayFn">
      <cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport [ngStyle]="{height: '200px'}" itemSize="25">
        <mat-option *cdkVirtualFor="let l of filteredSuppliers | async" [value]="l">
          {{ l.supplierCode }} - {{ l.supplierName }}
        </mat-option>
      </cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport>
    </mat-autocomplete> 
```


### Expected Behavior

Only the actual selected item should be shown selected with the checkmark icon.

### Actual Behavior

if the second item is selected, then when the viewport is refreshed with the next set of items, the 2nd item of the new set is also selected.


### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.7
- CDK/Material: 15.2.7
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatAutoComplete and CDKVirtualScrollViewPort issues with selected indicator" (#26934)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-dialog): NEST open MatDialog will missing enterAnimation for the inner dialog
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

13

### Description

When open a new MatDialog inside another dialog, it will missing enter animation for the innerdialog.
After checking the css, when open the second dialog after the first one, the class `mdc-dialog--open` apply immediately so that it cannot trigger the `--mat-dialog-transition-duration:150ms;` for the animation


```
.mdc-dialog--open .mdc-dialog__container {
    transform: none;
    opacity: 1;
}
```

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Install angular 15
2. Open 1 dialog
3. Open another dialog from this dialog
4. Missing animation


### Expected Behavior

should show the animation even for nest dialog

### Actual Behavior

should show the animation even for nest dialog

### Environment

- Angular: 15
- CDK/Material: 15.2.6
- Browser(s): Chrome / Edge
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-dialog): NEST open MatDialog will missing enterAnimation for the inner dialog" (#26931)

Issues.Title: bug(COMPONENT): ng update command throws error for Angular material packages
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

`ng update` command throws error for Angular material packages:

**Command**
`ng update @angular/cdk @angular/material @angular/google-maps --create-commits=true --force=true --next`

Require stack:
- \node_modules\@angular\cli\src\command-builder\utilities\schematic-engine-host.js
See "\AppData\Local\Temp\ng-At5sID\angular-errors.log" for further details.
```

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Use the below json file


```
{

    "@angular/router": "16.0.0-rc.0",
    "@angular/service-worker": "16.0.0-rc.0",
    "aspnet-prerendering": "3.0.1",
    "rxjs": "~7.8.0",,
    "tslib": "^2.3.0",
    "zone.js": "~0.13.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "^16.0.0-rc.0",
    "@angular/cli": "~16.0.0-rc.0",
    "@angular/compiler-cli": "^16.0.0-rc.0",
    "@types/fingerprintjs2": "2.0.0",
    "@types/jasmine": "~4.3.0",

### Expected Behavior

### Actual Behavior

- \node_modules\@angular\cli\src\command-builder\utilities\schematic-engine-host.js

Issues.Title: bug(material/date-picker): gray text color of input value in mat-dialog
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

before angular 15

### Description

Since angular 15 and new material color handling, there is a text color issue for mat-date-range-input in mat-dialog pop ups: text of input value is gray instead of black. In fact others inputs have black text in pop ups, and mat-date-range-input isn't homogeneous and seems disabled due to gray color.

Note: I'm not talking about mat-label, nor placeholder text colors (which are gray too) but about the color of the input value once set.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-gfjwgr-m8f5c2?file=src/app/date-range-picker-comparison-example.html
2. in main page, select dates in mat-date-range-input, and type text in text input => color of current values in both inputs is black (OK!)
3. click on button to open dialog
4. in dialog, select dates in mat-date-range-input, and type text in text input => color of current value in text input is black (OK!) but color of current value in mat-date-range-input is gray (KO)


### Expected Behavior

Text of mat-date-range-input value is black and homogeneous with others inputs in mat-dialog. 

### Actual Behavior

Text of mat-date-range-input value is gray instead of black in mat-dialog. 

### Environment

- Angular: ^15.0.0
- CDK/Material: ^15.0.0
- Browser(s): firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(material/date-picker): gray text color of input value in mat-dialog" (#26925)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-button): Can't apply theme for FAB and Mini-FAB buttons
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When defining theme it's possible to apply it to all components like:
`@include mat.all-component-themes($theme);`
But it was also possible to apply it to only specific components like:
`@include mat.button-theme($theme);`

However, the theme gets applied to buttons but not FAB and Mini FAB buttons.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Apply theme to mat-button component only

Forked official example:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-adcpb4?file=src/theme.scss

### Expected Behavior

Theme is applied to all buttons, including FAB and Mini-FAB.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20073913/231710948-7ca48a56-6206-42d8-b398-308306464e9e.png)


### Actual Behavior

Theme is not applied to FAB and Mini-FAB 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20073913/231711022-ec7d90ba-5938-43d4-9c72-d0ebc2ed11a3.png)


### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.6
- CDK/Material: 15.2.6
- Browser(s): Chromium 112.0.5615.49
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(mat-button): Can't apply theme for FAB and Mini-FAB buttons" (#26921)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-icon-button/radio-button/checkbox): Unable to reduce ripple size
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.x

### Description

For a button of any size, the default ripple size is displayed.

In certain scenarios, we need to fit in the button in smaller UI. As the ripple effect is taking more space than the button, it is creating a UI glitch.
If we reduce the size of button, still the ripple effect is taking unwanted space and hence I had to redesign the application.

Is there any way to override the ripple size "THROUGH CSS" as the other option (density) is not working as expected for our use cases


### Reproduction

Reference - https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-rumxmw?file=src%2Fapp%2Fbutton-overview-example.html

### Expected Behavior

The ripple effect also should be relative to the button

### Actual Behavior

The ripple effect is not relative to the button

Issues.Title: feat(QoL): We really need quality of life improvements / updates
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

A lot of developers, like me, are still stuck on version 14 and unable to update to 15
To me this project almost looks like a dead end (have a look at the amount of commits in 2023). Tons of issues are still open and important feature requests (2017 2018 etc) are not being picked up.
We as a company have designed our complete frontend to Angular Material and we need to know if we need to switch to another library. I know this is all open software, but we need to keep our application updated with Angular core, which we cannot do anymore

There is no Material roadmap, and (almost) no input from the developing team.
If this project is still alive, we need at least some information about QoL updates and issues need to be picked up.

### Use Case

_No response_
